Name: Early intervention system.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an early intervention system

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was heard but not signed at the Mayoral Public Hearing of July 7, 2020; the date of the anticipated bill-signing ceremony will be announced.

History.Description: This Introduction was Bill Signing Scheduled by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was signed at a ceremony held at 161th Street and Morris Avenue in The Bronx.

History.Description: This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Summary: The bill would require the department to maintain a centralized system that is used to record, track, review, and evaluate officer activity and to identify officers who may be in need of enhanced training, monitoring, or reassignment.

\v0\fs20\par
\ul\fs24 Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj  \par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\f1 Section 1. \f0 Chapter 1 of title 14 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to add a new section 14-190 to read as follows:\f2\fs20\par
\ul\f0\fs24\'a7 14-190 Early intervention system. a. The department shall maintain a centralized system that is used to record, track, review, and evaluate officer activity and to identify officers who may be in need of enhanced training, monitoring, or reassignment. Such system shall collect and utilize, at a minimum, the following: \par
(i) information reported pursuant to section 7-114; \par
(ii) complaints received and results of investigations conducted by the civilian complaint review board; \par
(iii) complaints received and investigations conducted by the department, including but not limited to investigations conducted by the internal affairs bureau, and any disposition resulting from any such investigation; \par
(iv) complaints received pursuant to section 804 of the charter; \par
(v) use of force incidents and incidents of excessive force, as those terms are defined in section 14-158;\par
(vi) arrests and summonses for violations of sections 240.20, 195.05 and 205.30 of the penal law; \par
(vii) judicial or departmental determinations that detentions of individuals were not legally justified; \par
(viii) criminal arrests or investigations of an officer, to the extent known to the department; \par
(ix) judicial determinations that an officer\rquote s testimony is not credible;\par
(x) vehicle pursuits and collisions involving department equipment;\par
(xi) violations of the department\rquote s patrol guide; \par
(xii) disciplinary actions and ongoing disciplinary proceedings; and\par
(xiii) non-disciplinary corrective actions. \par
b. By January 31 of each year, the department shall post on its website and submit to the mayor and the speaker of the council a report on the department\rquote s use of the early intervention system during the previous year, including, but not limited to (\cf0 i) any additional information, other than the information required to be included in such system by subdivision a of this section, that is collected and utilized through such system; (ii) the process for identifying, through such system, officers who may be in need of enhanced training or monitoring; (iii) the interventions utilized by the department with such officers; (iv) procedures and systems for ongoing monitoring of such officers to ensure improvement; and (v) any information required to be included in such system by subdivision a of this section that the department believes should be eliminated and the reasons why.\par
\cf1\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect on September 1, 2020.\fs20\par
\pard\ltrpar\par
